summary: After every tutoring session, Grog comes home and reads to Pike and Scanlan to show how much he has improved. Eventually, they...
body: After every tutoring session, Grog comes home and reads to Pike and Scanlan to show how much he has improved. Eventually, they no longer need to correct him on any pronunciation, and when they get a new family member, he reads to the child whenever Scanlan or Pike can’t.

summary: MISS ME? I had the thought a couple episodes back that they should leave the Scarlet Weasel with the Ruby of the Sea!? like, it...
caption:
MISS ME?

I had the thought a couple episodes back that they should leave the Scarlet Weasel with the Ruby of the Sea!? like, it works! But then I immediately got the image in my head of the old-style portraits of fancy ladies with their ferrets/ermine/ect. small pets and had to paint her.

**SPOILERS** under the cut

BUT THEN THEY LEAVE THE PUPPY!? MY BELOVED NUGGET? I’m glad he’ll be safe for the moment.. Particularly since Professor T. already peaced out but I’m still already missing him..

tags: this turned into polymachina???? at least the beginnings of it
also holy hell this would make a great longer fic
percival fredrickstein von mussel klossowski de rolo iii
summary: Scanlan and Percy, Pirate AU because that sounds fun
question: Scanlan and Percy, Pirate AU because that sounds fun
answer:
this is so good and i appreciate you so much right now

(this is basically vox machina as pirates and percy’s story still being pretty much the same tbh)

~

It’s been about two weeks since they fished the kid out of the water. He would have drowned if they hadn’t, and even so, Pike had to use a good portion of her healing for the day to stabilize him.

Scanlan still feels slightly nauseous at the memory of the wounds he only caught a glimpse of before Pike ordered them all to get the fuck out of the cabin and make themselves useful.

Whatever happened to the boy must have been a nightmare. It makes sense that he’s barely talking now and that even Scanlan hasn’t been able to get him to smile.

The twins, who are the closest to his age, though probably at least a little bit older, have taken it upon themselves to show their new crew member the ropes.

Despite everything, Percival is eager to make himself useful.

Except that he… well, he kinda sucks at this. He admits one night that he’s never sailed on a ship before, which they could all tell from a mile away already. And while he does have some impressive muscles, he still looks every inch the sheltered noble kid that Scanlan imagines he used to be.

“I used to be… somewhat of a tinkerer,” Percy tells them after almost an entire Grog-sized mug of ale. “I invented things. I’m normally very good with my hands, it’s just that they’re used to working on a much smaller scale.”

That makes a lot more sense. Percy, leaning over a workbench and fiddling with tiny gears and screws… yeah, that’s exactly the kind of vibe he gives off.

“You’ll get the hang of this soon, darling,” Vex'ahlia promises with a smile, “It took us all some getting used to.” She’s practically got stars in her eyes as she winks at Percival, and Scanlan catches Vax’s eye and they both roll their eyes. They’re used to Vex’s flirting by now. The only one on board who used to be of interest to her is Keyleth. But after a couple months of dancing around each other, they suddenly decided to just be friends.

“Was the sex that bad?” Scanlan asked Keyleth when he caught her alone.

Keyleth went beet red and shrugged. “No. It wasn’t… it was good… I mean…”

Scanlan interruptee her with a raised hand and patted her shoulder - even though he had to stretch a little to reach it.

That evening, he played cheesy romantic songs until Vex threatened to throw his lute overboard.

Now though, there’s nothing but friendship between her and Keyleth, and their resident druid watches her try to seduce Percy with the same interest as the rest of the crew.

Percy looks pretty uncomfortable though. He always kind of does, which is understandable since he’s only been here for two weeks, but still.

Scanlan leans forward. “So you’re a clever kid, then. More brains than brawn?”

Percy gives him a half glare. “Not a kid.”

“You’re the one not giving us your age,” Scanlan replies with a shrug.

“You’re one to talk, Shorthalt,” Vax murmurs, but Scanlan skillfully ignores him.

“Anyway. Back to my point. This whole operation needs some more clever people. Right now we’ve got me… and maybe Kiki over there, but she’s only smart in non-people related ways.”

“Which is your specialty,” Percy adds with a nod.

Scanlan smirks. “I doubt Pike keeps me around solely for my good looks.”

He dodges the half eaten apple Pike throws his way and grins.

“But you know, Percival… I’m kind of the mastermind behind our work.”

There’s a couple of snorts, but no one actually disagrees. Which, great, Scanlan’s ego can’t use more of that right now.

“I pick the cities we attack. The trade routes we intercept. I use the information we gather to keep us well fed and out of jail.” The pride in his voice isn’t played up this time, and he grins when Percy gives him an impressed nod.

Scanlan leans back on his bench and lets a silver coin dance along his fingers. “As you see, not every crew member has to be good at the physical side of things. Maybe you’d be better off becoming my… apprentice.” He lets the coin disappear - not with magic, but with a simple trick Dr. Dranzel taught him years ago.

Percy looks to Pike, who shrugs. “Can’t hurt to try. Honestly, it’s better than you getting in the way on deck.”

“Alright.” Percy straightens up. “You’ve got yourself a deal.”

Scanlan’s grin widens. “Tell me, Percival, have you ever forged a signature?”

Percy pauses for a moment, then smiles. “Not for anything serious but I’m always eager for new opportunities.”

~

Three years later, their crew is the most feared along the coast of Tal'Dorei and beyond.

Mostly because Percival, the crazy bastard, equipped the ship with an invention of his - cannons. No one can withstand those hellish weapons for long. They could take down entire fleets if they wished to do so.

And Scanlan? Scanlan thinks that this whole dangerous side to Percy, the way his passion and focus win them one battle after another, is really fucking hot.

It takes him a while to decide whether seducing Percy is worth letting his lute be flung to an early, watery grave.

Vex does get to him first, in the end.

But this crew has never been much for exclusivity.

Scanlan looks down at Percy’s sleeping face and then leans back in Vex’s arms. “You know we’re gonna have to deal with his shit eventually?”

Vex sighs and brushes a strand of white hair out of Percy’s face. “It’ll be worth it. Right?”

Scanlan watches as Percy scrunches up his face and nods. He reaches for Vex’s hand and presses a kiss to her knuckles. “Yeah, I think so.”

~

Three years later, their crew is the most feared along the coast of Tal'Dorei and beyond.

Mostly because Percival, the crazy bastard, equipped the ship with an invention of his - cannons. No one can withstand those hellish weapons for long. They could take down entire fleets if they wished to do so.

And Scanlan? Scanlan thinks that this whole dangerous side to Percy, the way his passion and focus win them one battle after another, is really fucking hot.

It takes him a while to decide whether seducing Percy is worth letting his lute be flung to an early, watery grave.

Vex does get to him first, in the end.

But this crew has never been much for exclusivity.

Scanlan looks down at Percy’s sleeping face and then leans back in Vex’s arms. “You know we’re gonna have to deal with his shit eventually?”

Vex sighs and brushes a strand of white hair out of Percy’s face. “It’ll be worth it. Right?”

Scanlan watches as Percy scrunches up his face and nods. He reaches for Vex’s hand and presses a kiss to her knuckles. “Yeah, I think so.”
trail.content:
this is so good and i appreciate you so much right now

(this is basically vox machina as pirates and percy’s story still being pretty much the same tbh)

~

It’s been about two weeks since they fished the kid out of the water. He would have drowned if they hadn’t, and even so, Pike had to use a good portion of her healing for the day to stabilize him.

Scanlan still feels slightly nauseous at the memory of the wounds he only caught a glimpse of before Pike ordered them all to get the fuck out of the cabin and make themselves useful.

Whatever happened to the boy must have been a nightmare. It makes sense that he’s barely talking now and that even Scanlan hasn’t been able to get him to smile.

The twins, who are the closest to his age, though probably at least a little bit older, have taken it upon themselves to show their new crew member the ropes.

Despite everything, Percival is eager to make himself useful.

Except that he… well, he kinda sucks at this. He admits one night that he’s never sailed on a ship before, which they could all tell from a mile away already. And while he does have some impressive muscles, he still looks every inch the sheltered noble kid that Scanlan imagines he used to be.

“I used to be… somewhat of a tinkerer,” Percy tells them after almost an entire Grog-sized mug of ale. “I invented things. I’m normally very good with my hands, it’s just that they’re used to working on a much smaller scale.”

That makes a lot more sense. Percy, leaning over a workbench and fiddling with tiny gears and screws… yeah, that’s exactly the kind of vibe he gives off.

“You’ll get the hang of this soon, darling,” Vex'ahlia promises with a smile, “It took us all some getting used to.” She’s practically got stars in her eyes as she winks at Percival, and Scanlan catches Vax’s eye and they both roll their eyes. They’re used to Vex’s flirting by now. The only one on board who used to be of interest to her is Keyleth. But after a couple months of dancing around each other, they suddenly decided to just be friends.

“Was the sex that bad?” Scanlan asked Keyleth when he caught her alone.

Keyleth went beet red and shrugged. “No. It wasn’t… it was good… I mean…”

Scanlan interruptee her with a raised hand and patted her shoulder - even though he had to stretch a little to reach it.

That evening, he played cheesy romantic songs until Vex threatened to throw his lute overboard.

Now though, there’s nothing but friendship between her and Keyleth, and their resident druid watches her try to seduce Percy with the same interest as the rest of the crew.

Percy looks pretty uncomfortable though. He always kind of does, which is understandable since he’s only been here for two weeks, but still.

Scanlan leans forward. “So you’re a clever kid, then. More brains than brawn?”

Percy gives him a half glare. “Not a kid.”

“You’re the one not giving us your age,” Scanlan replies with a shrug.

“You’re one to talk, Shorthalt,” Vax murmurs, but Scanlan skillfully ignores him.

“Anyway. Back to my point. This whole operation needs some more clever people. Right now we’ve got me… and maybe Kiki over there, but she’s only smart in non-people related ways.”

“Which is your specialty,” Percy adds with a nod.

Scanlan smirks. “I doubt Pike keeps me around solely for my good looks.”

He dodges the half eaten apple Pike throws his way and grins.

“But you know, Percival… I’m kind of the mastermind behind our work.”

There’s a couple of snorts, but no one actually disagrees. Which, great, Scanlan’s ego can’t use more of that right now.

“I pick the cities we attack. The trade routes we intercept. I use the information we gather to keep us well fed and out of jail.” The pride in his voice isn’t played up this time, and he grins when Percy gives him an impressed nod.

Scanlan leans back on his bench and lets a silver coin dance along his fingers. “As you see, not every crew member has to be good at the physical side of things. Maybe you’d be better off becoming my… apprentice.” He lets the coin disappear - not with magic, but with a simple trick Dr. Dranzel taught him years ago.

Percy looks to Pike, who shrugs. “Can’t hurt to try. Honestly, it’s better than you getting in the way on deck.”

“Alright.” Percy straightens up. “You’ve got yourself a deal.”

Scanlan’s grin widens. “Tell me, Percival, have you ever forged a signature?”

Percy pauses for a moment, then smiles. “Not for anything serious but I’m always eager for new opportunities.”

~

Three years later, their crew is the most feared along the coast of Tal'Dorei and beyond.

Mostly because Percival, the crazy bastard, equipped the ship with an invention of his - cannons. No one can withstand those hellish weapons for long. They could take down entire fleets if they wished to do so.

And Scanlan? Scanlan thinks that this whole dangerous side to Percy, the way his passion and focus win them one battle after another, is really fucking hot.

It takes him a while to decide whether seducing Percy is worth letting his lute be flung to an early, watery grave.

Vex does get to him first, in the end.

But this crew has never been much for exclusivity.

Scanlan looks down at Percy’s sleeping face and then leans back in Vex’s arms. “You know we’re gonna have to deal with his shit eventually?”

Vex sighs and brushes a strand of white hair out of Percy’s face. “It’ll be worth it. Right?”

Scanlan watches as Percy scrunches up his face and nods. He reaches for Vex’s hand and presses a kiss to her knuckles. “Yeah, I think so.”
